sources.title: Vulcan, Son of Jupiter
sources.description: 1961 produced by Joseph E. Levine directed by Emimmo Salvi. Starring Bella Cortez, Rod Flash Ilush, Liliana Zagra, Furio Meniconi, Roger Browne, Omero Gargano, Annie Gorassini and Gordon Mitchell. Filmed in Eastmancolor Supercinescope. Mount Olympus finds its peace broken by a horny Venus and some randy gods. Took four people to write the screenplay. Should be a delight for fans of bad movies.

metadata.Plot: Tired of the sexual escapades on earth by his daughter Venus, Jupiter, the god of Lightning, decides he shall marry her soon to one of the candidates: Maciste, a mortal working in Vulcano's cave, and Mars, the god of War. But Mars abducts Venus, allied with Pluto and Eris, and works out a plan involving a bamboo tower high enough for the soldiers of the Thracian King to attack Jupiter in the high Olympus. The gods' contend will be resolved in human fashion on Earth, where even gods are mortal.
metadata.Writer: Emimmo Salvi, Ambrogio Molteni, Gino Stafford
metadata.Actors: Bella Cortez, Iloosh Khoshabe, Liliana Zagra
